history.content:
Are you interested in community service, robotics, or mentoring? Then Pioneers in Engineering’s Mentor Decal is the place for you! Here is a link to our decal course: https://decal.berkeley.edu/courses/6083

Info-session Dates:
Thursday, 1/27 4-6 pm (Calapalooza Drop-in); Zoom Link: tinyurl.com/2022PiE
Thursday, 1/27 7-8 pm; Zoom Link: tinyurl.com/eduwurooms

If you are ready to add the class, here are the EECS 198 Section Times + CCN:
Monday, 6:30 - 8:00 pm (Online) CCN: 21910
Thursday, 6:30 - 8:00 pm (In-Person) CCN: 21911

What to Expect:
Two or three college students are assigned to mentor each high school team, guiding them through the engineering process of building a competition robot. This course is designed to provide mentors with the hands-on training, technical skills, and mentoring experience they will need to guide their team through the competition season. Classes will mainly consist of hands-on activities and group discussions, with some short presentations mixed in as well. Office hours can be scheduled with facilitators for additional assistance.

Questions?
Email: rcdecal@pioneers.berkeley.edu

Interest Form: tinyurl.com/mentorinfo22

Website: https://pioneers.berkeley.edu
